payload.summary: On February 24, 2026, the White House officially nominated Kevin Warsh to succeed Jerome Powell as Federal Reserve Chair. Dubbed the 'Warsh Shock,' the move signals a shift toward 'Sound Money' and an aggressive balance sheet pivot involving active asset sales (QT-for-cuts).
payload.market_impact: Expected USD strength due to hawkish policy expectations; yields saw a bear steepening with the 10-year Treasury surging. Commodities like gold and silver face downward pressure from higher yields and a stronger dollar.
